content:
Nozibele and the 
 thre hairs 
 
 Tesa Welch 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 A long time ago, thre girls went out to
 colect wod. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 It was a hot day so they went down to 
 the river to swim. 
 
 
 They played and splashed and swam in 
 the water. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Sudenly, they realised that it was late.
 
 
 They huried back to the vilage.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When they were nearly home, Nozibele 
 put her hand to her neck. 
 
 
 She had forgoten her necklace! 
 "Please come back with me!" she beged 
 her friends. 
 
 
 But her friends said it was to late. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 So Nozibele went back to the river alone.
 She found her necklace and huried
 home. 
 
 
 But she got lost in the dark. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 In the distance she saw light coming 
 from a hut. 
 
 
 She huried towards it and knocked at 
 the dor. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 To her surprise, a dog opened the dor
 and said, "What do you want?" 
 
 
 "I'm lost and I ned a place to slep," said
 Nozibele. 
 
 
 "Come in, or I'l bite you!" said the dog.
 
 
 So Nozibele went in. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Then the dog said, "Cok for me!" 
 
 
 "But I’ve never coked for a dog before," 
 she answered. 
 
 
 "Cok, or I'l bite you!" said the dog. 
 
 
 So Nozibele coked some fod for the 
 dog. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Then the dog said, "Make the bed for
 
 me!" 
 
 Nozibele answered, "I've never made a
 
 bed for a dog." 
 
 "Make the bed, or I'l bite you!" the dog
 
 said. 
 
 
 So Nozibele made the bed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Every day she had to cok and swep
 
 and wash for the dog. 
 
 Then one day the dog said, "Nozibele,
 
 today I have to visit some friends. Swep
 the house, cok the fod and wash my
 
 things before I come back." 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 As son as the dog had gone, Nozibele 
 
 tok thre hairs from her head. 
 
 She put one hair under the bed, one 
 
 behind the dor, and one in the kral. 
 
 
 Then she ran home as fast as she could. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When the dog came back, he loked for
 Nozibele. 
 
 
 "Nozibele, where are you?" he shouted.
 
 
 "I'm here, under the bed," said the first
 hair. 
 
 
 "I'm here, behind the dor," said the
 second hair. 
 
 
 "I'm here, in the kral," said the third hair.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 12  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Then the dog knew that Nozibele had 
 
 tricked him. 
 
 
 So he ran and ran al the way to the 
 vilage. 
 
 
 But Nozibele’s brothers were waiting 
 there with big sticks. 
 
 
 The dog turned and ran away and has 
 never ben sen since. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 13
